title: Stage serial port
desc: Find the port (path) for the stage.

title: Stage speed
desc: Set the fast stage speed

title: Stage speed
desc: Set the slower stage speed

title: Stage speed units
desc: micrometer/sec or millimeter/sec

title: Home stage on startup
desc: Homes the stage every time the GUI is started.

title: Stage limit
desc: limit to the stage to avoid obstacles (mm)

title: Move to start location
desc: Moves the stage to start coordinates every time the GUI is started.

title: Start location
desc: Move stage to these coordinates (mm)

title: Stage maxspeed
desc: Set the maximum stage speed

title: Stage maxspeed units
desc: micrometer/sec or millimeter/sec

title: Stage acceleration
desc: Set the stage acceleration

title: Stage acceleration units
desc: micrometer/sec^2 or millimeter/sec^2

title: Move in image space mode
desc: Control the stage movement relative to the image space. Requires calibration.

title: Default camera settings
desc: Select a valid pfs file

title: Display framerate
desc: how fast to show live images (fps)

title: Rotation
desc: Rotation of camera relative to stage

title: Image plane normal's direction.
desc: Image plane normal vector's direction (+X cross +Y in image space). Use to imply the direction of Y axis in camera-stage change of basis matrix.

title: Depth of Field (mm)
desc: Camera depth of field. Can be estimated in Depth of Field calibration tab.

title: Pixelsize
desc: Use calibration to calculate (um/px)

title: Proportional gain (P)
desc: How strongly the controller reacts to the current error.

title: Integral gain (I)
desc: How much the controller compensates for accumulated past errors.

title: Differential gain (D)
desc: How rapidly changing errors are dampened.

title: Focus Estimation Method
desc: The method which uses to estimate the focus value from an image.

title: Smoothing window size
desc: How far back (iterations) do we perform a linear, weighted average smoothing to the estimated focus value (PV). Defaults to 1, which means only consider the current value -- no smoothing.

title: Min steps before change dir
desc: Minimum step before allowin chaning direction. Defaults to 0, which means can change direction at any time.

title: Best focus value
desc: Current best focus value. Use as a target value for autofocusing. Automatically filled in from DoF calibration.

title: Focus FPS
desc: How frequent to perform autofocusing.

title: Show graph
desc: Display graph of focus values. Useful for tuning constants.

title: Stepsize
desc: how large are the (x,y) steps for autocalibration

title: Calibration step units
desc: micrometer or millimeter

title: Depth of Field search distance.
desc: Distance (mm) range about current position to estimate Depth of Field from.

title: Depth of Field number of sample images.
desc: Number of sample images to take to estimate Depth of Field from.

title: Dual Color mode
desc: Dual color mode changes the stage calibration and tracking computation

title: Main side
desc: Main side of the dual color mode that want to focus on. The main side will be use for tracking and calibration.

title: Viewing mode
desc:
Viewing mode of the dual color. 
Splitted: view the image as it is taken, where each channel are splitted on left and right.
Merged: merge both channels into one image. Requires dual color calibration.

title: Recording Mode
desc:
Recording mode when viewing in dual color mode. 
Original: Recording the images as it is taken. 
Splitted: Record the images by splitting each into left and right part, when the minor side is transformed to match the main side. Easy for later analysis.

title: Translation X
desc: Translation from minor to main in X axis

title: Translation Y
desc: Translation from minor to main in Y axis

title: Rotation
desc: Rotation from minor to main

title: Display tracking overlay
desc: Display the tracking overlay which shows the ROI and the center of mass of the object.

title: ROI (Width)
desc: Width of the tracking image in px

title: ROI (Height)
desc: Height of the tracking image in px

title: Capture radius (px)
desc: Radius around center that captures a worm

title: Minimal step (um)
desc: what is the smallest step during tracking that should be executed?

title: threshold (bits)
desc: What is considered a relevant change in the image (e.g., grayscale out of 255)?

title: Area (px)
desc: What is the relevant area that changes?

title: Binning
desc: Binning factor to increase thresholding speed.

title: Dark background
desc: True if the object appears bright and the background dark.

title: Tracking mode
desc: select tracking by difference, center of mass or max/min brightness.

title: Minimum Brightness
desc:
Minimum brightness threshold for tracking within integer range [0, 255]. 
Pixels with brightness value below this threshold will be set to 0.

title: Maximum Brightness
desc:
Maximum brightness threshold for tracking within integer range [0, 255]. 
Pixels with brightness value heigher than this threshold will be set to 0.

title: Display live analysis
desc: Display statistical and analytical values of the image.

title: Save to the recording
desc: Save the live analysis data into the recording file.

title: Region mode
desc: Compute the values over the full image or only on the tracking region

title: Show FPS
desc: Display the FPS counter on the top right corner.
